review_title: Very bright but the switch is faulty
reviews:
The flashlight is(was?) very bright but the switch is faulty. It broke after 5 months of very infrequent use. Very disappointed because the rest of the flash light looks to be well constructed. The switch smells like something is hot and burning if I have the battery cap on the flashlight. Note the battery cap is what contains the switch. You don't want to find out that the switch is broken when you have no power. Very frustrating.

UPDATE: I was able to remove the faulty switch and disassemble it. The plastic parts that push the contacts were worn or not manufactured correctly and so they were no longer able to push the contact all the way. I was able to replace the switch with one like in the attached photo. You can buy it here on amazon. Look for "Magic&shell Round Rocker Power Switch". The picture shows a new rocker switch on the left and one placed inside the battery cap. Note that I bent the contacts to make it work. I initially just bent the contacts on the new switch but then I found that the side contact didn't always make a perfect connection so I ended up soldering one of the contacts from the broken switch on the side contact of the rocker switch. It's worked perfectly so far. The second picture shows what the flashlight looks like with the rocker switch
